title: Global HIV/AIDS Statistics and Progress (2023 Data)
summary: This report from HIV.gov provides a comprehensive overview of the global HIV/AIDS epidemic using 2023 statistics. It details the number of people living with HIV (39.9 million), new infections (1.3 million, declining), progress in testing and treatment access (ART), and the reduction in AIDS-related deaths. Initiatives like PEPFAR are highlighted for their significant impact. While a secular public health report, the content touches upon the sanctity of life and the importance of compassion and care for the suffering, themes resonant with Christian values derived from our axioms. The fight against disease reflects a response to the brokenness of the world (a consequence of sin, Genesis 3), and efforts to heal and support align with Christ's example (Matthew 25:36). The report underscores the ongoing need for global commitment, mirroring the Christian call to love our neighbours.
